What documents are needed for reimbursem: The necessary documents for reimbursement claims include a completed claim form, bills, payment receipts, the patient's medical history, a discharge certificate or summary from the hospital, cash memos from hospitals/chemists supported by prescriptions, payment receipts, investigation test reports supported by prescriptions, the attending medical practitioner's certificate with diagnosis date and bill receipts, a surgeon's certificate stating the diagnosis and nature of the operation with bills/receipts, and for domiciliary hospitalization, a medical certificate stating the type of claim. Pre-authorization is subject to the insured person providing relevant medical details; refusal to provide these may result in denial of cashless access.

Can an insured person cancel the policy: The insured person may cancel a new policy within the 30-day free look period.  If unsatisfied with the terms and conditions, they may cancel; this option is available for policies with a term of one year or more.  Refunds are subject to deductions for expenses incurred by the Company and stamp duty charges.  The policy can also be canceled by the company in the case of established fraud by the insured person by giving 15 days’ written notice. What are the exclusions for plastic or c: Expenses for cosmetic or plastic surgery are excluded unless for reconstruction following an accident, burn(s), or cancer, or as part of medically necessary treatment to remove a direct and immediate health risk, certified by the attending Medical Practitioner.
Is there a restriction on claims made in: If a claim is fraudulent, or if a false statement is made, or fraudulent means are used to obtain benefits, all benefits and premiums are forfeited. Any amounts already paid will be repaid by the recipient(s)/policyholder(s).

What are the defined zones under zone-wi: The country is divided into four zones: Zone I (Greater Mumbai Metropolitan area, entire state of Gujarat); Zone II (NCT Delhi and NCR, Chandigarh, Pune); Zone III (Chennai, Hyderabad, Bangalore, Kolkata); and Zone IV (Rest of India).  Co-payments apply if treatment is taken in a zone other than the one for which the premium was paid; the co-payment percentages vary depending on the zones involved.
Does the policy cover treatment taken ou: All medical treatment for the purpose of this insurance will have to be taken in India only.
What is the waiting period for pre-exist: Expenses related to the treatment of a pre-existing disease and its direct complications are excluded until 36 months of continuous coverage after the first policy's inception date.  This waiting period may be reduced based on prior continuous coverage.
How many days of pre- and post-hospitali: The policy covers medical expenses for 30 days prior to hospitalization and up to 60 days post-hospitalization.

Are short-term hospital stays covered un: Treatment requiring a hospital stay of more than 24 hours, even if shortened by technology, is covered.
What is defined as an accidental injury: Injury means accidental physical bodily harm, excluding illness or disease, resulting solely and directly from sudden, accidental, external, violent, and visible means.
What makes a treatment 'medically necess: Medically necessary treatment means any treatment, tests, medication, or stay in a hospital required for medical management of illness or injury.

Is there any benefit or waiver available: Proportionate deductions related to room rent are waived under specific conditions.
What are the exclusions under domiciliar: Domiciliary hospitalization does not cover expenses for specific situations; criteria are detailed within the policy.
What are the criteria for medical treatm: Domiciliary hospitalization means medical treatment for illness/disease/injury requiring home treatment, subject to policy conditions.
Is treatment for dog bites covered, and: Treatment for dog bites is covered, but the specific benefit category is not defined in the provided clauses.
Does the policy have a waiting period fo: There is a 36-month waiting period from the policy's first inception for specified diseases; other waiting periods may apply depending on the specific condition.
Are pre-existing diseases covered immedi: Coverage for pre-existing diseases after 36 months is subject to continuity benefits, including waiting periods.  If the disease was pre-existing at policy inception, longer waiting periods may apply.
What does the policy define as a reasona: Reasonable and customary charges are defined as charges for services or supplies that are not in excess of what is considered standard for the same medical treatment in the same locality.
How is room rent limit calculated across: Room rent limits are enhanced for Gold, Diamond, and Platinum plans (Sum Insured of Rs. 6.0 lacs and above), while Silver plans (Sum Insured of Rs. 1.0 lac to Rs. 5.0 lacs) have a different enhancement calculation.  The room category and incurred room rent affect the limit.
Is there any restoration of sum insured: If the sum insured is exhausted due to a claim, it is automatically restored.  The restoration amount may have limits and may not exceed the selected basic sum insured.
Are AYUSH treatments included under the: The policy covers Ayurveda treatments but excludes other AYUSH treatments, massages, and steam baths.
What happens if two policies cover the s: If an insured person has multiple policies covering the same risk, they have the right to prefer claims under this policy. The insurer will coordinate payments if more than one insurer has been charged for the same medical treatment.
What expenses are not covered if the ins: Expenses incurred for treatment in a hospital or by a medical practitioner without proper registration are excluded.
What are the age eligibility criteria fo: Dependent children are covered from 91 days to 18 years; male children may be covered up to 25 years if they are full-time students.  If a child over 18 is financially independent or a female child is married, they are ineligible.
Is there any maximum entry age for famil: The maximum entry age under the policy is 65 years for all members.
Does the policy offer personal accident: The policy includes personal accident coverage.  If an accident occurs during the policy period, a fixed amount (10% of the base sum insured) may be payable; details depend on the plan.
What is the benefit payable if the insur: If death is due to an accident, a fixed amount (10% of the base sum insured) is payable under the Platinum plan only.
What are the exclusions under the person: The company is not liable under the personal accident section for injuries or death due to self-inflicted injury, attempted suicide, or injuries sustained while participating in illegal activities.  Additional exclusions may apply.
Is there any benefit under the policy if: The policy provides a benefit for total permanent disability resulting from an accident within 365 days of the accident, as specified in the Platinum plan.  Details about this benefit are not fully available.
Can the policyholder claim telemedicine: The policy covers expenses incurred for telemedicine consultations with a registered medical practitioner.
What amount is reimbursed for telemedici: The maximum amount reimbursed for telemedicine consultations is Rs. 2,000/- per family per policy period.
How does the insurer define 'network pro: Network providers are hospitals or healthcare providers listed by the insurer, TPA, or jointly by both, that provide cashless medical services to insureds.
What is the waiting period for cataract: There is a 36-month waiting period from the first policy inception for cataract surgery, unless the waiting period is reduced according to extant IRDAI regulations.
How is chronic kidney failure defined an: Chronic kidney failure is defined as chronic irreversible failure of both kidneys.  Coverage is subject to policy terms and conditions; alcohol or drug abuse related kidney failure is excluded.
Are modern treatments like robotic surge: Robotic surgeries and hematopoietic stem cell transplants for bone marrow transplants are covered; other stem cell transplants may have different coverage based on specifics. There may be sub-limits.
What are the defined sub-limits for oral: Oral chemotherapy has a sub-limit of 25% of the sum insured per policy period, while immunotherapy (monoclonal antibody) has a sub-limit up to INR 1,50,000 per policy period.
Can the policy be extended for internati: The policy can be extended to cover SAARC countries.  Claims from treatment in other countries (except when the policy is extended to SAARC countries) are reimbursed.
What is covered under the critical illne: The Platinum plan's critical illness benefit includes an additional sum insured increase of 10% for critical illness treatment, upon diagnosis. The specific covered critical illnesses are not detailed in the given information.
Who can be covered under this family flo: The policy covers the proposer and one or more family members as defined in the policy.
How long must the policy be active befor: Maternity expenses are covered, but only if the pregnancy is not diagnosed within 36 months prior to the policy's effective date.
What is meant by contribution under this: Contribution is the right of an insurer to call upon other insurers liable for the same insured event; if multiple policies cover the same event, the insurers share the cost.
Does the policy cover maternity expenses: MATERNITY EXPENSES shall include Medical treatment expenses traceable to childbirth (including complicated deliveries and caesarean sections) incurred during Hospitalization.
Are ambulance charges covered under this: Ambulance service charges are payable only if the Hospitalization expenses are admissible under the policy.
What is the co-payment clause, if any?: CO-PAYMENT means a cost sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that the policyholder/insured will bear a specified percentage of the admissible claims amount.
Are day care procedures covered?: DAY CARE TREATMENT means medical treatment, and/or surgical procedure which is: Undertaken under General or Local Anesthesia in a hospital/day care centre in less than 24 hrs.
Are congenital diseases covered?: CONGENITAL ANOMALY refers to a condition(s) which is present since birth, and which is abnormal with reference to form, structure or position.
Is dental treatment included in the poli: DENTAL TREATMENT means a treatment related to teeth or structures supporting teeth including examinations, fillings (where appropriate), crowns, extractions and surgery.
Is there any cover for mental illness tr: MENTAL ILLNESS means a substantial disorder of thinking, mood, perception, orientation or memory.
Is domiciliary hospitalization allowed?: Domiciliary treatment in India under Domiciliary Hospitalization Benefits as hereinafter defined, the treatment is admissible only if the In-patient Hospitalization claim for such Hospitalization is admissible by the Insurance Company.
Are inherited or genetic disorders cover: CONGENITAL ANOMALY refers to a condition(s) which is present since birth, and which is abnormal with reference to form, structure or position.
What is the process for filing claims?: NOTIFICATION OF CLAIM means the process of intimating a claim to the insurer or TPA.
Is there cashless hospitalization availa: Cashless facility means a facility extended by the insurer to the insured for availing medical services from network providers.
Are newborn babies automatically covered: NEW BORN BABY means baby born during the Policy Period and is cover from day 1.
What is the policy\u2019s grace period f: GRACE PERIOD means the specified period of time immediately following the premium due date during which a payment can be made to renew or continue a policy in force without loss of continuity benefits.
What are the premium payment options?: The grace period for premium payment is fifteen days when paid in a single payment, and a shorter period if paid in installments.
Are second medical opinions covered?: The policy states that expenses must be "necessarily and actually incurred for medical treatment on account of Illness or Accident on the advice of a Medical Practitioner".
Is coverage provided outside India?: Coverage is not provided outside of India.
Are diagnostic tests reimbursed?: Diagnostic tests are covered if they are "medically necessary" and part of treatment prescribed by a physician.
Is there a disease-wise capping or exclu: The policy may restrict coverage to a specified list of diseases, but details are not provided.
Are claims settled on a reimbursement or: The policy offers a cashless facility, but the specific process or conditions are not described in detail.
Does the policy have a family floater op: The policy is called a "HAPPY FAMILY FLOATER POLICY 2024", indicating family coverage.
Does the policy cover alternative birth: The policy covers expenses for Cesarean sections.
Is hospitalization required for cataract: The policy states that for a claim to be admissible, hospitalization of more than 24 hours would have been required.
Is there a cap on room rent per day?: If the room rent incurred is higher than the policy's eligibility, the policyholder will bear a proportionate share of the extra cost.  This does not apply to medicines, drugs, consumables, devices, or diagnostics.
Does the policy cover organ donor expens: The policy covers in-patient hospitalization medical expenses for organ donors if the donation complies with the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994 and related regulations; however, costs associated with organ acquisition, donor screening, pre/post hospitalization expenses for the donor, and complications from organ harvesting are excluded.
Is outpatient (OPD) treatment covered?: The Platinum plan reimburses OPD expenses up to Rs. 5,000 every three years for dental and ophthalmic care, including consultations, tests, and prescribed medicines.
What is the sum insured restoration bene: If the sum insured is reduced or exhausted due to a claim, it's automatically restored up to the opted restoration limit (50% or 100%) at policy inception; however, the total restored amount during the policy period can't exceed the chosen limit, and this benefit is only available under the Silver and Gold plans.
Does the policy cover robotic or advance: Robotic surgeries are covered, with a sub-limit of 10% of the sum insured, up to a maximum of INR 1,00,000 for sum insured slabs from Rs. 1.0 lac to Rs. 10.0 lacs and INR 2,00,000 for sum insured slabs from Rs. 12.0 lacs to Rs. 50.0 lacs.  This amount is in addition to the conventional surgery limit.
Does the policy cover infertility treatm: Expenses related to sterility and infertility, including contraception, sterilization, assisted reproduction services, surrogacy, and sterilization reversal, are excluded except for the Platinum plan, which has specified limits.
What is the policy\u2019s cancellation a: If the policyholder cancels, a proportionate refund for the unexpired period is given for annual policies with no claims made.  If any claim has been admitted or a benefit availed, no refund is provided. The company may cancel for misrepresentation/non-disclosure with no premium refund.
Does the policy offer lifetime renewabil: The policy is ordinarily renewable, except for fraud or misrepresentation; however, specific details on lifetime renewability aren't available.
Is there a sub-limit for specific treatm: Yes, there are sub-limits for specific treatments like uterine artery embolization, balloon sinuplasty, deep brain stimulation, and others, varying by sum insured slab.
Is air ambulance covered in the policy?: Air ambulance is covered under the Platinum plan, up to 5% of the sum insured, for life-threatening emergencies requiring rapid transport and where ground transportation is insufficient, subject to specific conditions and only once during the policy lifetime.
Can the policy be ported to another insu: Yes, the policy can be ported to another insurer at least 30 days before, but not earlier than 60 days from the policy renewal date, as per IRDAI guidelines.
Are health supplements or vitamins reimb: Dietary supplements and vitamins are not reimbursed unless prescribed by a medical practitioner as part of a hospitalization claim or day-care procedure.
Is HIV/AIDS treatment covered?: The policy covers in-patient care, pre, and post-hospitalization expenses related to HIV infection.
Is coverage different for senior citizen: Persons aged 65–70 can be covered under Silver or Gold plans with a 20% co-payment on each claim, applying to all subsequent renewals; coverage under Diamond and Platinum plans is not available for those above 65.
Can sum insured be enhanced during renew: Sum insured can be enhanced at renewal, but increases are subject to specific conditions, such as the number of claims in the preceding policy periods and the age of those insured.  The policy may allow for increased sum insured up to two slabs higher if family size increases.
Are maternity-related expenses covered u: Maternity expenses, including childbirth, complicated deliveries, Cesarean sections during hospitalization, and lawful medical termination of pregnancy, are covered.  However, expenses related to ectopic pregnancy and miscarriage (unless due to an accident) are excluded.
What treatments or conditions are explic: Treatments or conditions explicitly excluded include those arising from war, intentional self-injury, participation in military operations, illnesses within 30 days of policy commencement (except accidents), and sterility/infertility (including contraception, sterilization, and assisted reproduction services).  Additionally, expenses for treatments listed in a specified diseases/procedures waiting period are excluded for 24 months after policy inception, unless caused by an accident or underlying cancer.
Is organ donor surgery covered, includin: Medical and surgical expenses for the organ donor are covered if the insured person is the recipient; however, expenses incurred by the insured person while donating an organ are not covered.  Pre- and post-hospitalization expenses for the donor are also excluded.
What is the co-payment or deductible cla: The policy mentions co-payments and deductibles but does not specify their amounts or conditions.  Further details are needed from the policy contract.
Does the policy cover outpatient consult: Pre-hospitalization medical expenses for consultations, investigations and medicines incurred upto 60 days before the date of admission to the hospital, day care, or domiciliary treatment are covered. Diagnostic procedures are also included under in-patient treatment.
What is the room rent limit per day and: The policy states that hospital room rent or boarding is included under in-patient treatment; however, no specific daily limit or impact on reimbursement is mentioned in the provided clause.
Does the policy offer coverage for criti: Yes, the policy offers coverage for critical illness as an optional benefit, which is effective only if mentioned in the schedule.
Is reimbursement available for home nurs: Expenses related to custodial care either at home or in a nursing facility for personal care, such as help with activities of daily living by skilled nurses or assistants, are excluded.
Does the policy cover treatment in tier-: Yes, the policy covers medical treatment taken within India, and Tier 2 cities are defined as "rest of India - all other cities" for premium calculation purposes.
Are expenses for speech and hearing impa: No, the provision or fitting of hearing aids is not covered.
Is coverage extended during policy grace: Coverage is not available during the grace period.
Are coronary angioplasty charges covered: Angioplasty and/or any other intra-arterial procedures are excluded.
Is Ayurvedic postnatal care covered?: Ayush expenses incurred for inpatient care treatment under ayurveda, yoga and naturopathy, unani, siddha and homeopathy system of medicines shall be covered upto sum insured, during each policy year as specified in the policy schedule.
Are doctor consultation fees covered und: OPD treatment means the one in which the Insured visits a clinic / hospital or associated facility like a consultation room for diagnosis and treatment based on the advice of a Medical Practitioner.
Does the policy allow adding newborns mi: Children Aged between 1 to 90 Days can be covered if Newborn Baby Benefit is added by payment of additional premium subject to policy terms and conditions.
Are pacemakers covered under the sum ins: Sum Insured means the sum shown in the Schedule which represents Our maximum liability for each Insured Person for any and all benefits claimed for during the Policy Year.
Are renal transplant follow-ups covered?: The actual undergoing of a transplant of:   One of the following human organs - heart, lung, liver, pancreas, kidney, that resulted from irreversible end-stage failure of the relevant organ or;   Human bone marrow using hematopoietic stem cells. The undergoing of a transplant must be confirmed by specialist medical practitioner.
Does the policy cover obesity-related co: Expenses related to the surgical treatment of obesity that does not fulfil all the below conditions are not covered.
Is treatment for epilepsy reimbursed?: Treatment for epilepsy is reimbursed if it requires hospitalization, evidence of permanent neurological deficit lasting at least 3 months is provided, and excludes transient ischemic attacks, traumatic brain injury, and vascular diseases affecting only the eye, optic nerve, or vestibular functions.
Is treatment for thyroid disorders cover: Treatment for thyroid disorders is covered if it requires hospitalization, aims to return the person to their state of health before the illness, and includes a detailed list of services and unit prices.
Is accidental death covered under this p: If the Injury, within 12 months, is the sole and direct cause of death, the Company will pay 100% of CSI.
Are cataract surgeries reimbursed?: The policy covers ophthalmic ailments due to trauma/infection/age-related diseases/foreign body removals; however, cosmetic eye surgeries and Lasik are excluded.
Are ambulance charges covered in rural a: Ambulance service charges are covered up to a maximum of Rs. 3000 per policy period, or 1% of the Sum Insured, for life-threatening emergencies requiring immediate transportation to a hospital when ground transportation is unavailable and treatment is not available at the Insured Person's location.
Are fertility preservation treatments co: Expenses related to sterility and infertility, including IVF, are excluded, except for Platinum plans, up to the limits specified.
Are anti-rabies vaccinations included?: Anti-rabies vaccination is included if it forms part of treatment requiring hospitalization, as per Section 3.1.10.
Is hospitalization for alcohol-related i: Mental conditions associated with alcohol abuse are excluded.
Is chemotherapy covered for pediatric ca: Chemotherapy is covered as part of inpatient care, including pre and post hospitalization expenses.
Does the policy provide maternity covera: Maternity expenses are covered for delivery (including C-section) or lawful termination of pregnancy, but there is no specific mention of coverage for twins.
Is breast cancer screening covered?: Carcinoma in situ of breasts is excluded.
Are daycare procedures for ENT included?: Day care procedures are covered if performed in a hospital/day care center in less than 24 hours, and the facility meets specified criteria.  There is no specific mention of ENT procedures.
Does the policy support second opinion f: The policy covers Medical Expert’s fees for a second opinion on specified major illnesses,  subject to the hospitalization claim being admissible.
Are growth hormone treatments covered fo: Hormone replacement therapy is excluded unless part of medically necessary treatment, except for puberty and menopause-related disorders.
Are diagnostic charges covered for tuber: Diagnostic expenses are excluded if the admission is primarily for diagnostics and evaluation, or if they are unrelated to the current diagnosis and treatment.
Does the policy include HIV/AIDS-related: The policy covers medical expenses for inpatient care and pre- and post-hospitalization expenses related to HIV infection.
Does the policy include coverage for rar: This coverage is available for Platinum Plan only. This cover is limited for one child once in lifetime only. If the couple has one living child this benefit will not be available.
Are liver transplant procedures reimburs: H. MAJOR ORGAN/BONE MARROW TRANSPLANT the actual undergoing of a transplant of one of the following human organs: heart, lung, liver, kidney, pancreas that resulted from irreversible end-stage failure of the relevant organ, or Human bone marrow using hematopoietic stem cells.
Is dental cleaning covered under this po: 4.26 Dental treatment Dental treatment, unless necessitated due to an Injury.
Is accidental disability benefit part of: B. PERSONAL ACCIDENT COVER: (WORLD – WIDE): If at any time during the currency of the Policy, the Insured Person sustains any bodily Injury, resulting solely and directly from sudden, unforeseen and involuntary event caused by external, visible and violent means anywhere in the world, and if such Injury, within  12 months of its occurrence be the sole and direct cause of death or disability, as covered under the Policy,  then the Company undertakes to pay to the insured or his nominee or in the absence of nominee, the legal heir, as the case may be, the following sums: No. Coverage Amount payable 1 Accidental Death only 100 % of CSI 2 Loss of two entire limbs, or sight of two eyes or one entire Limb and sight of one eye. 100 % of CSI 3 Loss of one entire limb or Sight of one eye 50 % of CSI 4 Permanent Total Disablement resulting in totally and absolutely disabling the person insured from engaging in any Employment or occupation whatsoever. 100 % of CSI

Are prescribed mobility aids like crutch: A. is required for the medical management of the illness or injury suffered by the insured; B. must not exceed the level of care necessary to provide safe, adequate and appropriate medical care in scope, duration, or intensity; C. must have been prescribed by a medical practitioner; D. Must conform to the professional standards widely accepted in international medical practice or by the medical community in India.
Is coverage available for accidental den: 2.22 INJURY means accidental physical bodily harm excluding illness or disease solely and directly caused by external, violent, visible and evident means which is verified and certified by a Medical Practitioner.
